intro: Flaveria linearis, commonly known as the slenderleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats and has linear, grass-like leaves. It produces small yellow flowers that develop into fluffy seed heads, aiding in wind pollination. Flaveria linearis is often used in ecological studies due to its adaptability and role in supporting pollinators.
